meanings.definition: The negatively charged electrode in an electrical device.
meanings.sent1: The kathodes in the battery help to power the flashlight.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to connect the wires to the kathodes correctly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the electron refuse to hang out with the kathodes? Because they were always so negative!
meanings.sent4: The kathodes acted like a magnet, attracting all the electrical currents towards them.
meanings.sent5: The kathodes looked like tiny magnets, pulling in all the electricity around them.

meanings.definition: The point where rays of light or other radiation converge after passing through a lens.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens focused the light onto the kathodes, creating a clear image.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied how the kathodes helped to concentrate the light beams.
meanings.sent3: The kathodes were like tiny mirrors, reflecting all the light back to the source.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like kathodes, drawing in all the beauty and brightness around her.
meanings.sent5: The kathodes of the telescope gathered all the starlight, revealing the wonders of the night sky.
